intro: Pedicularis sudetica var. gymnocephala, commonly known as the naked-headed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. This variant is distinguished by its lack of bracts on the flower cluster, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
